newsitem.title: PERU: Peru says May consumer price inflation 0.76 pct.
newsitem.headline: Peru says May consumer price inflation 0.76 pct.

text.p: Peruvian consumer prices rose 0.76 percent in May, compared with a 0.7 percent rise in the same month last year and a 0.39 percent rise in April, the government's statistics agency said Monday.

Wholesale prices rose 0.99 percent in May, compared with a 1.0 percent rise in the same month last year and a 0.30 percent rise in April, the National Institute for Statistics and Information (INEI) announced in the official gazette, El Peruano.
Consumer prices increased 3.02 percent in the period January to May, compared to 5.9 percent in the same period last year.
Wholesale inflation for the first five months of the year was 1.84 percent, compared to 4.6 percent in the January to May period last year, the INEI said.
Consumer prices in Peru rose 11.8 percent in 1996, compared with a 10.2 percent rise in 1995.
In 1996, accumulated inflation for wholesale prices was 11.4 percent, up from 8.80 percent the previous year.
The government estimates accumulated consumer inflation will be nine percent this year and will drop to "the level of industrialized countries" by 2000.
